articles.author: Ziyi Tang, Ryan Woo
articles.description: Local governments in China have sold record amounts of so-called special bonds this year to inject capital into struggling smaller banks, as authorities seek to contain spillover risks from a deepening property crisis and a sputtering economy.
articles.title: Debt-laden China's local governments scramble to rescue small banks with $21 bln in special bonds

articles.author: Katherine Masters, Arriana McLymore
articles.description: As China-founded e-commerce behemoth Shein moves to list in New York, U.S. lawmakers are again calling on it to prove that forced labor is not used to make its $5 T-shirts and $10 sweaters.
articles.title: Shein’s IPO raises fresh questions on alleged forced labor in its supply chain

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: Walt Disney (DIS.N) CEO Bob Iger told employees that he faced a "myriad of challenges" upon returning to the company but remained upbeat about its prospects.
articles.title: Disney CEO Bob Iger says company is ready to start building

articles.author: Howard Schneider, Ann Saphir
articles.description: Federal Reserve policymakers look increasingly likely to end this year with interest rates on hold and begin 2024 mulling the timing of their first cut in borrowing costs as they try to engineer a "soft landing" for the economy.
articles.title: Fed likely done raising interest rates; Waller flags possible cut

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The Federal Aviation Administration said on Tuesday it had adopted a new aircraft certification policy requiring key flight control design changes to be considered "major" like the system involved in two fatal Boeing (BA.N) 737 MAX crashes in 2018 and 2019.
articles.title: US FAA tightens aircraft certification oversight after Boeing MAX crashes

articles.author: Sarah Wu
articles.description: For years, Hota Industrial Mfg. Co has made gears, shafts and other auto parts in Taiwan and shipped them to large foreign carmakers such as Tesla (TSLA.O), Ford Motor (F.N) and General Motors (GM.N).
articles.title: Taiwanese Tesla supplier Hota retools supply chain with first US factory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Uber (UBER.N) will open up its platform to London's black cabs early next year, the ride-hailing firm said on Wednesday, signalling a dramatic turnaround in its relationship with drivers of the British capital's iconic taxis.
articles.title: Black cab U-turn: Uber to partner with London cabbies after decade of dispute

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammemd Salem, Henriette Chacar
articles.description: Hamas and Israel were expected to release more hostages and prisoners on Wednesday, the last day of a prolonged six-day truce in the Gaza Strip conflict, as attention focused on whether mediator Qatar could negotiate another extension.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas due to release more people amid efforts to extend truce

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: Indian rescuers on Tuesday pulled out all 41 construction workers trapped for 17 days inside a collapsed tunnel in the Himalayas, hours after drilling through the debris of rock, concrete and earth to reach them.
articles.title: All trapped Indian workers rescued from Himalayan tunnel, say officials

articles.author: Philip Pullella
articles.description: Pope Francis has removed some of the Vatican privileges of conservative American Cardinal Raymond Burke, including a large subsidized apartment and his salary, a senior Vatican official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Pope strips conservative US cardinal of Vatican privileges, Vatican official says
